alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 4:07PM MDT until August 28 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Strong thunderstorms producing heavy and excessive rainfall will lead to localized flooding. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. This includes the northern portions of the Albuquerque metro area and Placitas. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 407 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Albuquerque, southern Rio Rancho, Bernalillo, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Sandia Pueblo, North Valley, Sandia Heights, Vista Hills, Santa Ana Pueblo, South Valley, Alameda, Placitas and Carnuel. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 154 and 169. Highway 550 near Mile Marker 1. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 225 and 245. This includes the following low water crossings... Richfield Ave and Eubank NE, Holbrook St and Alameda NE, Eagle Rock Ave NE between Tennyson and Lowell, Modesto Ave NE between Tennyson and Lowell, Glendale Ave and Browning St NE, Bobcat Blvd NE at Domingo Baca Arroyo, Spring Creek Dr NE Sandia Heights North, Live Oak Loop NE Sandia Heights, Live Oak Court to Tramway Ln NE Sandia Heights, Browning St NE between Anaheim and Corona Ave NE and Corona Ave NE between Browning and Eubank NE.
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
